body_html:
I've seen a nearly identical issue. The major difference is that I didn't build with XLA+CUDA; I only built with CUDA.

OSX 10.12.3
Retina MacBookPro 10,1 mid 2012.
Nvidia GT 650M
Python 2.7.13 build in a virtual environment from brew with the latest requirements from pip
Latest build requirements from brew (wheel, six, etc)
Latest CUDA 8.0.63
Latest cuDNN 5.1.10

The issue only started after I brew upgraded bazel to 0.4.4 a few days ago.
Reverting my brew install of bazel to 0.4.3 has allowed me to complete compilations and create a pip install package.

Fixed as follows:
brew uninstall bazel
Copy bazel 0.4.3 brew formula from:
https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/f4c0bf580fc94d31dbe09ddeab35b1ee3ac17c9e/Formula/bazel.rb
Paste this old formula into brew config for bazel:
brew edit bazel
Install the older version of bazel
brew install bazel
Pin this currently installed "older version" of bazel
brew pin bazel

The only other issue was that I needed to massage bazel with the following fix:
#4187 (comment)

For quick reference here is the changelog of bazel:
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md

body:
I've seen a nearly identical issue. The major difference is that I didn't build with XLA+CUDA; I only built with CUDA.

OSX 10.12.3
Retina MacBookPro 10,1 mid 2012.
Nvidia GT 650M
Python 2.7.13 build in a virtual environment from brew with the latest requirements from pip
Latest build requirements from brew (wheel, six, etc)
Latest CUDA 8.0.63
Latest cuDNN 5.1.10

The issue only started after I brew upgraded bazel to 0.4.4 a few days ago.
Reverting my brew install of bazel to 0.4.3 has allowed me to complete compilations and create a pip install package. 

Fixed as follows:
`brew uninstall bazel`
Copy bazel 0.4.3 brew formula from:
https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/f4c0bf580fc94d31dbe09ddeab35b1ee3ac17c9e/Formula/bazel.rb
Paste this old formula into brew config for bazel:
`brew edit bazel`
Install the older version of bazel
`brew install bazel`
Pin this currently installed "older version" of bazel
`brew pin bazel`

The only other issue was that I needed to massage bazel with the following fix:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/4187#issuecomment-244722024

For quick reference here is the changelog of bazel:
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
